rule.name: Nurgle's Gift
rule.effect: All Death Guard units in your army reduce the toughness of enemy models by 1 within Contagion Range (this effect does not stack).

detachments.name: Plague Company
detachments.effect: if a Death Guard unit is controlling an objective marker in your Command Phase it inffects the objective marker with the Nurgle's Gift Army Rule, while it is inffected the objective stays under your control even if no models are controlling it. An opponent can cleanse the objective of Nurgle's Gift by controlling it at the start of end on any turn.

select.rule: During the Declare Battle Formations step, select one of the Sicknesses below. Until the end of the battle, all units from your army with the Nurgle’s Gift ability gain the selected Sickness.

options.title: Skullsquirm Blight (Aura)
options.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this unit, worsen the Ballistic Skill and Weapon Skill characteristics of weapons equipped by models in that enemy unit by 1.

options.title: Rattlejoint Ague (Aura)
options.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this unit, worsen the Save characteristic of models in that enemy unit by 1.

options.title: Scabrous Soulrot (Aura)
options.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this unit, worsen the Leadership and Objective Control characteristics of models in that enemy unit by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

enhancements.name: Living Plague
enhancements.effect: Death Guard Model Only. Add 3 to the range of the bearer's Aura Abilities (including Nurgle's Gift)

enhancements.name: Deadly Pathogen
enhancements.effect: Death Guard Model Only. Add 1 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons. While the bearer is within range of an Infected objective marker you control, add 2 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons instead.

enhancements.name: The Droning
enhancements.effect: Death Guard Model Only. While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of the bearer, each time that unit fails a Battle-shock test, roll one D6: on a 2-5, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 6, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

enhancements.name: Shamblerot
enhancements.effect: Death Guard Model Only. Each time the bearer’s unit is selected as a target of an enemy unit’s charge, until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

stratagems.name: Ferric Blight
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If the target of that attack is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control and a Critical Wound is scored for that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2 instead.

stratagems.name: Disgustingly Resilient
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: Sanguous Flux
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. While your unit is within range of an Infected objective marker you control, those weapons have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

stratagems.name: Gifts of Decay
stratagems.target: One Death Guard model from your army.
stratagems.effect: Your model regains up to D3 lost wounds. If your model’s unit is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control, your model regains up to 3 lost wounds instead.

stratagems.name: Boilblight
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army, and one enemy unit within Contagion Range of that unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a weapon equipped by a Death Guard model from your army targets that enemy unit, that weapon has the [HEAVY] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

stratagems.name: Cloud of Flies
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability.

data.name: Grandfather’s Blessing (Aura, Psychic)
data.effect: While a friendly Death Guard Infantry unit is within Contagion Range of this model, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

roster.name: Daemon Prince of Nurgle with Wings

data.name: Warp Horror (Psychic)
data.effect: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it. That unit must take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Devastating Assault
data.effect: Each time this model ends a Charge move, until the end of the turn, its hellforged weapons have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

leader.name: The Destroyer Hive
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a melee attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the hit roll.

data.name: The Eater Plague (Pschic)
data.effect: In Your Shooting Phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to the Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker's unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.

leader.name: Chaos Lord
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

data.name: Desiccation Conduit (Aura)
data.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, at the end of the turn, roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

leader.name: Chaos Lord
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

data.name: Desiccation Conduit (Aura)
data.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, at the end of the turn, roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

leader.name: Master of Destruction
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

data.name: Blight Bombardment
data.effect: Each time a friendly Death Guard model makes an attack with a Blast weapon that targets a unit that is visible to this model, add 1 to the Hit roll and that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

leader.name: Vector of Disease
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, you can re-roll the hit roll

data.name: Abundance of Sickness
data.effect: In the Fight phase, each time this model loses a wound, roll one D6: on a 4+, the closest enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model suffers 1 mortal wound.

leader.name: Putrescent Vitality (Psychic)
leader.effect: At the start of the Fight phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in this Psyker’s unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

data.name: Pestilent Familiar (Psychic):
data.effect: Once per battle, after selecting targets for a Psychic weapon equipped by this model, until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Damage characteristics of that weapon by 2.

ranged.name: Curse of the Leper – Focused Witchfire

data.name: Gift of Contagion (Psychic)
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes a melee attack, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

data.name: Pestilent Fallout (Psychic)
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, if one or more of those attacks made with its Plague Wind scored a wound against an enemy Infantry unit, until the start of your next turn, subtract 2 from that unit’s Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

data.name: Remorseless
data.effect: While this unit is in range of an objective marker you control, each time you take a Battle-shock test for this unit, add 1 to that test.

data.name: Silent Bodyguard
data.effect: While a Character is leading this unit, if the Strength of an attack targeting this unit exceeds this unit's toughness, remove 1 from the wound roll.

data.name: Curse of the Walking Pox
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack that destroys an enemy model (excluding Monster and Vehicle models), you can return one destroyed Poxwalker model to this unit.

While Typhus is leading this unit, enemy models destroyed as a result of Typhus’ The Eater Plague ability count as enemy models destroyed by an attack made by a model in this unit for the purposes of this ability.

leader.name: Sickening Vitality
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, you can re-roll Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

data.name: The Bell Tolls (Aura)
data.effect: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, each time a Battle-shock or Leadership test is taken for that enemy unit, subtract 2 from that test.

You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same Leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leader.name: Putrefying Stink
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.

data.effect: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leader.name: Foul Infusion
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. In addition, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

data.name: Explosive Maladies
data.effect: Once per battle, in your Shooting phase, you can target this model with the Grenade Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.

You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leader.name: Malicious Calculations
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

data.name: The Seven-fold Chant
data.effect: In your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, roll 2D6: on a 7+, you gain 1CP.

You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leader.name: Tainted Narthecium
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, in your Command phase, you can return 1 destroyed Bodyguard model to that unit.

data.name: Diseased Healing
data.effect: At the end of your Movement phase, you can select one friendly Death Guard Infantry Character model within 3" of this model. That model regains up to 3 lost wounds. Each model can only be selected for this ability once per turn.

You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

data.name: Blistering Fusillade
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, if it targets the closest eligible enemy unit, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

data.name: Silent Bodyguard
data.effect: While a Character is leading this unit, if the Strength of an attack targeting this unit exceeds this unit's toughness, remove 1 from the wound roll.

data.name: Infused with the Blessings of Nurgle
data.effect: Each time this model is selected to shoot or fight, after it has finished making its attacks, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is always considered to be within Contagion Range of a unit from your army.

data.name: Enraged Impact
data.effect: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it and roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

data.name: Helbrute Fists
data.effect: If this model is equipped with two Helbrute fists, those weapons have the [TWIN-LINKED] ability.

data.name: Regenerating Monstrosities
data.effect: At the start of each player’s Command phase, one model in this unit regains up to D3 lost wounds.

data.name: Tank Hunters
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets a Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

data.name: Hovering Death
data.effect: This model is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

data.name: Spore-laced Shock Waves
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, if one or more of those attacks made with its Plagueburst mortar scored a hit against an enemy Infantry unit, that Infantry unit must take a Battle-shock test.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Assault Ramp
data.effect: Each time a unit disembarks from this model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Annihilator
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, re-roll a Damage roll of 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Destructor
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets an Infantry unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Scuttling Walker
data.effect: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over friendly Monster and Vehicle models and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Self Repair
data.effect: At the start of your Command phase, this model regains 1 lost wound.

data.name: Lord of the Death Guard (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, that unit can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

Primarch.title: Host of Plagues
Primarch.effect: At the start of the battle round, select one of the below abilities, until the start of the next battle round, this model has that ability.

abilities.name: Miasma of Pestilence (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, models in that unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

abilities.name: Diseased Influence (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

abilities.name: Toxic Presence (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 12" of this model, add 3" to the Contagion Range of that unit.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

leader.name: Unclean Icon
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

data.name: Seed the Disease
data.effect: Once per battle, at the end of your Movement phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the start of your next Command phase, this model’s unit is treated as having a Contagion Range of 12".

You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

data.name: Putrescent Fog (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Death Guard unit is wholly within 6" of this Fortification, each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Diseased Cover
data.effect: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this Fortification, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

data.name: Fortification
data.effect: While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more Fortifications from your army:
That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
Models in that unit do not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.

rule.name: Harbingers of Dread
rule.effect: If your Army Faction is Chaos Knights, each model from your army with this ability gains a bonus depending on which Dread abilities are active for your army (see below). Once a Dread ability is active for your army, that ability applies until the end of the battle.

walker.name: Super-Heavy Walker
walker.effect: Each time a model with this ability makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over models (excluding Titanic models) and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.

range.name: Despair (Aura)
range.effect: While an enemy unit is within 12" of this model, each time that enemy unit takes a Battle-shock or Leadership test, subtract 1 from that test.

range.name: Doom and Darkness
effect: Each time this model makes an attack, if the target is Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Wound roll.
Each time an attack targets this model, if the attacking model’s unit is Battle-shocked, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

detachments.name: Traitoris Lance
detachments.effect: In the Battle-shock step of your opponent’s Command phase, if an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength is within 12" of a Chaos Knights model from your army, that enemy unit must take a Battle- shock test. For the purposes of this ability, if a unit has a Starting Strength of 1, it is considered to be below its Starting Strength while it has lost one or more wounds.

enhancements.name: Lord of Dread
enhancements.effect: Chaos Knights model only. At the start of the Fight phase, you can select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of the bearer; that enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.

enhancements.name: Aura of Terror
enhancements.effect: Chaos Knights model only. If you control an objective marker at the end of your Command phase, and the bearer is within range of that objective marker, that objective marker is said to be Tainted and remains under your control even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. In addition, while an objective marker is Tainted and under your control and the Despair Dread ability is active for your army, that objective marker has the Despair Dread ability as if it was a Chaos Knights model from your army (so subtract 1 from Battle-shock and Leadership tests taken for enemy units within 12" of it).

enhancements.name: The Traitor's Mark
enhancements.effect: Chaos Knights model only. The Doom and Darkness ability is active for the bearer from the first battle round onwards, instead of from the third.

enhancements.name: Panoply of the Cursed Knights
enhancements.effect: Chaos Knights model only. Each time an attack is made against the bearer, subtract 1 from the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: Dread Hounds
stratagems.when: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: Two or more War Dog units from your army and one enemy unit that is an eligible target for each of those selected War Dog units.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, the selected War Dog units can only target that enemy unit, but all weapons equipped by those War Dog models gain the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked, until the end of the phase, each time a selected War Dog model makes an attack against that enemy unit, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

stratagems.name: Pterrorshades
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test.
stratagems.target: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that is within 12" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Roll six D6. For each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound and this model regains up to 1 lost wound.

stratagems.name: Disdain for the Weak
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your model has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against attacks made by Battle-shocked models.

stratagems.name: a Long Leash
stratagems.target: One Abhorrent model from your army and up to three War Dog models from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, those War Dog models count as being within range of any Aura abilities that Abhorrent model has.

stratagems.name: Diabolic Bulwark
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, that Chaos Knights model has a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

stratagems.name: Knights of Shade
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.target: Up to two War Dog models from your army or one Titanic Chaos Knights model from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, the selected models can move horizontally through models and terrain features as if they were not there.

data.name: Executioner
data.effect: Each time this model makes an attack that targets a unit Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Hit roll.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Stalker
data.effect: Each time this model makes an attack that targets an enemy unit, if there are no other units from your opponent’s army within 6" of that target, add 1 to the Wound roll.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Karnivore
data.effect: You can re-roll Charge rolls made for this model.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Brigand
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Huntsman
data.effect: Each time this model makes an attack against a Monster or Vehicle unit, re-roll a Wound roll of 1 and re-roll a Damage roll of 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Dread Dominion (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly War Dog is within 9" of this model, each time that War Dog takes a Battle-shock test, add 1 to that test.

data.name: Seething Hatred
data.effect: Each time this model is selected to shoot or fight, you can re-roll one Hit roll or you can re-roll one Wound roll when resolving those attacks.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 5 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Obsessive Ruthlessness
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack against a Monster or Vehicle unit, that attack has the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

data.name: Taskmaster (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly War Dog model is within 9" of this model, each time that War Dog model makes a ranged attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 5 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Bloodlust
data.effect: Each time this model makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, its melee weapons have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, once per battle, this model is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

data.name: Frenzied Rampage (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly War Dog model is within 9" of this model, each time that War Dog model makes a melee attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 5 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Vortex Terrors (Psychic)
data.effect: At the start of your Shooting phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of this model. That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Warp Storms (Psychic)
data.effect: At the end of your Movement phase, roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 9" of this model: on a 3+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 5 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Infernal Aegis (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly War Dog model is within 6" of this model, that War Dog model has the Benefit of Cover.

data.name: Bastion of Corruption
data.effect: Enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" of this model.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-8 wounds remaining, subtract 5 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

rule.name: The Shadow of Chaos
rule.effect: If your Army Faction is Legiones Daemonica, certain areas of the battlefield are considered to be within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, as follows:
range: Your deployment zone is always within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.
At the start of any phase, if you control at least half of the objective markers within No Man’s Land, until the end of that phase, No Man’s Land is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

At the start of any phase, if you control at least half of the objective markers within your opponent’s deployment zone, until the end of that phase, your opponent’s deployment zone is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

manifest.name: Daemonic Manifestation
manifest.effect: While a Legiones Daemonica unit from your army is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, each time that unit takes a Battle-shock test, add 1 to that test and, if that test is passed, one model in that unit regains up to D3 lost wounds (if that unit is a Battleline unit and that test is passed, up to D3 destroyed models can be returned to that unit instead).

terror.name: Daemonic Terror
terror.effect: While an enemy unit is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, each time that unit takes a Battle-shock test, subtract 1 from that test and, if that test is failed, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

detachments.name: Daemonic Incursion
detachments.effect: Each time a Legiones Daemonica unit from your army is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, if it is set up wholly within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, it can be set up anywhere that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models, instead of more than 9".

enhancements.name: A’rgath, the King of Blades
enhancements.effect: Khorne Legiones Daemonica model only. Add 1 to the Attacks and Strength characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons. While the bearer is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, add 2 to the Attacks and Strength characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons instead.

enhancements.name: Soulstealer
enhancements.effect: Slaanesh Legiones Daemonica model only. Each time the bearer destroys an enemy model with a melee attack, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the bearer is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos. On a 4+, the bearer regains 1 lost wound.

enhancements.name: The Endless Gift
enhancements.effect: Nurgle Legiones Daemonica model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability. While the bearer is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, the bearer has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability instead.

enhancements.name: The Everstave
enhancements.effect: Tzeentch Legiones Daemonica model only. Add 1 to the Strength characteristic of the bearer’s ranged weapons and increase the Range characteristic of such weapons by 3". While the bearer is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of the bearer’s ranged weapons and increase the Range characteristic of such weapons by 6" instead.

stratagems.name: Corrupt Realspace
stratagems.target: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
stratagems.effect: That objective marker is said to be Corrupted and remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. In addition, while an objective marker is Corrupted and under your control, the area of the battlefield within 6" of that objective marker is considered to be within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

stratagems.name: Draught of Terror
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1. In addition, until the end of the phase, each time such a weapon targets a unit that is Battle-shocked, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: Warp Surge
stratagems.target: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even if it Advanced this turn.

stratagems.name: Denizens of the Warp
stratagems.target: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy models.
stratagems.restrictions: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

stratagems.name: The Realm of Chaos
stratagems.target: Up to two Legiones Daemonica units from your army that are within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, or one other Legiones Daemonica unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. They will arrive back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units with this Stratagem.

stratagems.name: Daemonic Invulnerability
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an invulnerable saving throw is made for a model in your unit, re-roll a saving throw of 1.

data.name: Rage Embodied (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Khorne Legiones Daemonica unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles) is within 6" of this model, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit.

data.name: Murderlust (Aura)
data.effect: While a unit is within 6" of this model, each time that unit is selected to Fall Back, it must take a Leadership test. If that test is failed, that unit must Remain Stationary this phase instead.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Daemon Lord of Khorne (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Khorne Legiones Daemonica unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

data.name: Relentless Carnage
data.effect: At the end of the Fight phase, you can select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model and roll eight D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

leader.name: Lord of Decapitations
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

data.name: Skulls for Khorne
data.effect: Each time this model makes an attack that targets a Character unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll. Each time this model destroys an enemy Character unit, you gain 1CP.

leader.name: Bloodmaster
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

data.name: A Gory Path
data.effect: Each time this model’s unit Consolidates, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".

leader.name: Skullmaster’s Fury
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time that unit ends a Charge move, until the end of the turn, Juggernaut’s bladed horns equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

data.name: Devastating Charge
data.effect: Each time this model’s unit ends a Charge move, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of that unit must take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Blood Throne
data.effect: At the start of the Fight phase, select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this model. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Khorne Legiones Daemonica unit makes an attack that targets that unit, improve the Strength, Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics of that attack by 1.

data.name: Champion Slayer
data.effect: Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a Character or Monster unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll. Each time this model destroys an enemy Character or Monster unit, this model regains up to D6 lost wounds.

leader.name: Pack Leader
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, you can re-roll Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

data.name: Prey of the Blood God
data.effect: At the start of the first battle round, select one enemy unit to be this model’s prey. Weapons equipped by models in this model’s unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability when targeting this model’s prey. Each time this model’s prey is destroyed, select one new enemy unit to be this model’s prey.

wargear.name: Collar of Khorne
wargear.effect: The bearer has the Feel No Pain 3+ ability against Psychic Attacks.

data.name: Blood Begets Blood
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If that attack targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

wargear.name: Daemonic Icon
wargear.effect: Models in the bearer’s unit have a Leadership characteristic of 6+.

wargear.name: Instrument of Chaos
wargear.effect: Add 1 to Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit.

data.name: Brass Stampede
data.effect: Each time this unit ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this unit and roll one D6 for each model in this unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

wargear.name: Daemonic Icon
wargear.effect: Models in the bearer’s unit have a Leadership characteristic of 6+.

wargear.name: Instrument of Chaos

data.name: Pouncing Hunters
data.effect: You can target this unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already used that Stratagem on a different unit this phase.

data.name: Skulls of the Fallen
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. That unit must take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Shadow of Khorne (Aura)
data.effect: The area of the battlefield within 6" of this Fortification is considered to be within your army’s Shadow of Chaos. In addition, while a friendly Khorne Legiones Daemonica unit is within 6" of this Fortification, each time you take a Battle-shock test for that unit, you can re-roll that test.

data.name: Cover
data.effect: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this Fortification, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

data.name: Fortification
data.effect: While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more Fortifications from your army:
That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
Models in that unit so not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.

data.name: One Head Looks Forward (Aura)
data.effect: Each time you target a friendly Tzeentch Legiones Daemonica unit within 6" of this model with a Stratagem, roll one D6: if the result is greater than the current battle round number, you gain 1CP.

data.name: One Head Looks Back
data.effect: Once per battle, after your opponent uses a Stratagem, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the battle, each time your opponent uses that Stratagem, increase its cost to your opponent by 1CP.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Daemon Lord of Tzeentch (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Tzeentch Legiones Daemonica unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack.

data.name: Master of Magicks (Psychic)
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, select one of the following abilities: [IGNORES COVER]; [LETHAL HITS]; [SUSTAINED HITS D3]. Until the end of the phase, this model’s Bolt of Change has that ability.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Formless Horror
data.effect: Each time an enemy unit wishes to select this model as the target of an attack, that unit must first take a Battle-shock test. If that test if failed, in addition to being Battle-shocked, that enemy unit cannot target this model this phase.

data.name: Mischief and Confusion
data.effect: At the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, select one enemy unit within 12" of and visible to this model and roll one D6: on a 2-5, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll; on a 6, that enemy unit is not eligible to shoot this phase.

leader.name: Fateskimmer

data.effect: Once per battle, at the end of your opponent’s turn, if this model’s unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove that unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.

leader.name: Fluxmaster
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time an attack is made against that unit, subtract 1 form the Hit roll.

data.name: Altered Reality (Psychic)

data.name: P’tarix’s Sorcerous Syphon (Aura)

leader.name: Changecaster

data.name: Storm of Mutating Sorcery (Psychic)

data.name: Split
data.effect: Each time a Blue Horror model in this unit is destroyed, after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, if this unit is not destroyed, roll one D6 for that model. On a 4+, add one Brimstone Horror model to this unit.

data.name: Cackling Horrors (Aura)
data.effect: While an enemy unit is within 6" of this unit, if this unit contains one or more Blue Horror models, subtract 1 from that enemy unit’s Leadership characteristic.

data.name: Exploding Horrors
data.effect: Each time this unit is selected to fight, you can select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it, then select one or more Brimstone Horror models in this unit. For each Brimstone Horror model you select, roll one D6: on a 4+, that model is destroyed and that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

data.name: Split
data.effect: Each time a Pink Horror or Blue Horror model in this unit is destroyed, after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, if this unit is not destroyed, roll one D6 for that model. On a 4+, if it was a Pink Horror, add two Blue Horror models to this unit, and if it was a Blue Horror, add one Brimstone Horror model to this unit.
If, at any point, this unit contains no Pink Horror models, use the Blue Horrors datasheet for this unit.

data.name: Flames of Change (Psychic)

On a 4+, until the end of your opponent’s next turn, that enemy unit is aflame. While a unit is aflame, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

roster.name: Daemon Prince of Chaos with Wings

allegiance.effect: If this model has the Khorne keyword, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of this model’s hellforged weapons.
If this model has the Tzeentch keyword, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s infernal cannon.
If this model has the Nurgle keyword, add 1 to this model’s Toughness characteristic.
If this model has the Slaanesh keyword, add 2" to this model’s Move characteristic.

keywords: Daemon Prince of Chaos with Wings

data.name: Malefic Destruction
data.effect: Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s hellforged weapons.

data.name: Harbinger of Death
data.effect: Each time this model is selected to fight, select one of the following abilities. Until the end of the phase, this model’s hellforged weapons have that ability:
[LETHAL HITS]
[PRECISION]
[SUSTAINED HITS 1]

rule.name: Blessings of Khorne
rule.effect: If your Army Faction is World Eaters, at the start of the battle round, you can make a Blessings of Khorne roll. To do so, roll eight D6. You can then use those dice to activate up to two Blessings of Khorne from the Blessings of Khorne list (see right). Each Blessing of Khorne specifies the dice results it requires (where a number is specified, a double or triple of that value or higher is required). You can only activate each Blessing of Khorne once per battle round. Any unused dice from the Blessings of Khorne roll are then discarded. Once activated, each Blessing of Khorne applies to all units from your army with this ability until the end of the battle round.

rolls.name: Rage-Fuelled Invigoration
rolls.effect: Add 2" to the Move characteristic of models in this unit.

rolls.name: Wrathful Devotion
rolls.effect: Models in this unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability. If models in this unit already have the Feel No Pain ability, add 1 to their Feel No Pain rolls.

rolls.name: Martial Excellence
rolls.effect: Melee weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

rolls.name: Total Carnage
rolls.effect: Each time a model in this unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

rolls.name: Warp Blades
rolls.effect: Melee weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

rolls.name: Unbridled Bloodlust
rolls.effect: This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

detachments.name: Berzerker Warband
detachments.effect: Each time a World Eaters unit from your army is selected to fight, if that unit made a Charge move this turn, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit.

enhancements.name: Favoured of Khorne
enhancements.effect: World Eaters model only. Once per battle round, when you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, before doing anything else, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, discard all of the dice from that roll and make a new Blessings of Khorne roll. This new roll does not count as a re-roll, so any rules that enable you to re-roll or manipulate individual dice (e.g. Icon of Khorne) can still be used.

enhancements.name: Berzerker Glave
enhancements.effect: World Eaters model only. Add 1 to the Attacks and Damage characteristics of melee weapons equipped by the bearer. Each time the bearer ends a Charge move, roll one D3; until the end of the turn, add the result of that roll to the Attacks and Damage characteristics of those melee weapons instead.

enhancements.name: Battle-Lust
enhancements.effect: World Eaters model only. You can select the bearer’s unit for the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.

enhancements.name: Helm of Brazen Ire
enhancements.effect: World Eaters model only. Each time an attack is allocated to the bearer, halve the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: Gory Massacre
stratagems.target: One World Eaters unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
stratagems.effect: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

stratagems.name: Disgustingly Resilient
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: For the Blood God!
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after a World Eaters unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
stratagems.target: That World Eaters unit.
stratagems.effect: Make a Blessings of Khorne roll. You can use the results of this roll to activate one Blessing of Khorne. That Blessing of Khorne does not count towards your maximum number of activated Blessings of Khorne, but all other rules for Blessings of Khorne apply.

stratagems.name: For the Skull Throne!
stratagems.target: One World Eaters unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets a Character, Monster or Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: Khorne Cares Not...
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One World Eaters unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

stratagems.name: Blood Offering
stratagems.target: One World Eaters unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

stratagems.name: Apoplectic Frenzy
stratagems.target: One World Eaters unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

data.name: Reborn in Blood
data.effect: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if this model is destroyed, you can use a triple 6 from that roll to use this ability. If you do, this model is no longer destroyed and is placed into Reserves with its full wounds remaining.

Primarch.title: Wrathful Presence
Primarch.effect: At the start of your Charge phase, select one Wrathful Presence ability (see left). Until the start of your next Charge phase, this model has that ability.

abilities.name: Glorious Bloodletting (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this model, each time a Charge roll is made for that unit, add 1 to the roll.

abilities.name: Infectious Rage (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly World Eaters unit that is below its Starting Strength is within 6" of this model, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit. For the purposes of this ability, if a unit has a Starting Strength of 1, it is considered to be below its Starting Strength while it has lost one or more wounds.

abilities.name: Righteous Slaughter (Aura)
abilities.effect: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

leader.name: Legendary Killer
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1 and re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

leader.name: The Betrayer
leader.effect: At the end of your Charge phase, if this model is leading a unit and that unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you must take a Leadership test for this model. If that test is failed, one Bodyguard model of your choice in that unit is destroyed.

data.name: Berzerker Frenzy
data.effect: If this model is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. It can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

leader.name: Counter-attacks
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

data.name: Road of Eight Bloody Steps
data.effect: At the start of the battle, before any moves are made using the Scouts ability, you can select up to two friendly World Eaters Infantry units within 6" of this model that do not have the Scouts ability. Until the end of the battle, all models in the selected units have the Scouts 6" ability.

data.name: Infernal Fortitude (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly World Eaters Infantry unit is within 6" of this model, models in that unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

data.name: Devastating Assault
data.effect: Each time this model makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, its hellforged weapons have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

data.name: Bloodied Terror
data.effect: At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model must take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Oath to Khorne
data.effect: At the start of the battle, select one unit from your opponent’s army to be this model’s sworn foe. Each time this model makes an attack that targets that sworn foe, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll. If, at the end of the battle, that sworn foe has not been destroyed, this model is destroyed.

leader.name: Aggressive Advance
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, you can re-roll any or all of the following rolls made for that unit: Advance rolls; Charge rolls; Blood Surge rolls (see Khorne Berzerkers).

data.name: Bloody Stampede
data.effect: Each time this model’s unit ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model and roll one D6: on a 2-3, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 4-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.

leader.name: Trophy Taker
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.

data.name: Murderous Swing
data.effect: Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a Character unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

data.name: Blood Surge
data.effect: Each time an enemy unit is selected to shoot, after that unit has finished making its attacks, if any models from this unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, this unit can make a Blood Surge move. To do so, roll one D6: this unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but this unit must finish that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding Aircraft). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. A unit cannot make a Blood Surge move while it is Battle-shocked.

wargear.name: Icon of Khorne
wargear.effect: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can re-roll one of the dice.

data.name: Objective Ravaged
data.effect: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

wargear.name: Icon of Khorne
wargear.effect: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, if the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can re-roll one of the dice.

data.name: Bloody Fury
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if this unit is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if this unit is Below Half-strength.

data.name: Beacons of Rage (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly World Eaters unit is within 6" of this unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If that attack targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

data.name: Overwhelming Wrath (Aura)
data.effect: Each time an enemy unit within 6" of this unit is selected to Fall Back, that unit must take a Leadership test. If that test is failed, that unit must Remain Stationary this phase instead.

data.name: Assault Ramp
data.effect: Each time a unit disembarks from this model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Annihilator
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, re-roll a Damage roll of 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Destructor
data.effect: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets an Infantry unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Scuttling Walker
data.effect: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over friendly Monster and Vehicle models and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Furious Onslaught
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, after this model has finished making its attacks, if one or more of those attacks scored a hit against an enemy Infantry unit, that Infantry unit must take a Battle-shock test.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Frenzy
data.effect: Each time an enemy unit targets this model, after that unit has finished making its attacks, this model can either shoot as if it were your Shooting phase or fight as if it were the Fight phase.

data.name: Helbrute Fists
data.effect: If this model is equipped with two Helbrute fists, those weapons have the [TWIN-LINKED] ability.

data.name: Swooping Predator
data.effect: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move and roll two D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: The Scent of Blood
data.effect: Each time you make a Charge roll for this model, if one or more of the targets of that charge are below their Starting Strength, add 2 to that roll. Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll.

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

data.name: Self Repair
data.effect: At the start of your Command phase, this model regains 1 lost wound.

data.name: Regenerating Monstrosities
data.effect: At the start of each player’s Command phase, one model in this unit regains up to D3 lost wounds.

data.name: Blessed Slaughter
data.effect: Each time you make a Blessings of Khorne roll, for each enemy unit destroyed by this model in the previous battle round, you can add 1 to or subtract 1 from one of the dice rolled (each dice can only be modified in this way once, and a dice cannot be modified below 1 or above 6).

damaged.effect: While this model has 1-8 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

rule.name: Cabal of Sorcerers
rule.effect: If your Army Faction is Thousand Sons, at the end of your Command phase, each model from your army with this ability that is on the battlefield (excluding Battle-shocked models) generates you a number of Cabal points equal to the number shown in its ability (e.g. a model with the Cabal of Sorcerers 2 ability would generate you 2 Cabal points). The combined total of these is your Cabal points pool. During the battle round, you can use Rituals from the list below, deducting the Cabal points cost of each one from your Cabal points pool. If you do not have enough Cabal points for a Ritual, you cannot use it. Each Ritual can only be used once per phase. At the start of your next Command phase, your Cabal points pool resets to zero. Each time you use a Ritual, select one Thousand Sons Psyker model from your army, then apply that Ritual’s effect using that Psyker.

spells.name: Weaver of Fates (Psychic)
spells.effect: Use this Ritual at the start of any phase. Once during that phase, when a saving throw is failed for a friendly Thousand Sons model whose unit is within 18" of this Psyker, you can re-roll that saving throw.

spells.name: Temporal Surge (Psychic)
spells.effect: Use this Ritual at the start of your Shooting phase. Select one friendly Thousand Sons unit within 18" of this Psyker; unless that unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, that unit is not eligible to declare a charge this turn.

spells.name: Echoes from the Warp (Psychic)
spells.effect: Use this Ritual at the start of any phase. Once this phase, you can select this Psyker’s unit as the target of a Stratagem for 0CP, even if you have already used that Stratagem this phase.

spells.name: Doombolt (Psychic)
spells.effect: Use this Ritual at the start of your Shooting phase. Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2-5, it suffers D3+3 mortal wounds; on a 6, it suffers D3+6 mortal wounds.

spells.name: Twist of Fate (Psychic)
spells.effect: Use this Ritual at the start of any phase. Select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker; until the end of the phase, armour saving throws cannot be made for models in that unit.

detachments.name: Cult of Magic
detachments.effect: In your Command phase, you can select one of the abilities listed below to take effect until the start of your next Command phase.

select.rule: During the Declare Battle Formations step, select one of the Sicknesses below. Until the end of the battle, all units from your army with the Nurgle’s Gift ability gain the selected Sickness.

options.title: Malevolent Charge
options.effect: Psychic weapons equipped by Thousand Sons models from your army have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

options.title: Psychic Maelstrom
options.effect: Psychic weapons equipped by Thousand Sons models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

options.title: Wrath of the Immaterium
options.effect: Psychic weapons equipped by Thousand Sons models from your army have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

enhancements.name: Lord of Forbidden Lore
enhancements.effect: Thousand Sons Psyker model only. The bearer can be selected to use a Ritual even if another Psyker from your army has already been selected to use that Ritual this phase.

enhancements.name: Athenaean Scrolls
enhancements.effect: Thousand Sons Psyker model only. In your Command phase, if the bearer is on the battlefield and is not Battle-shocked, it generates you 1 additional Cabal point this phase.

enhancements.name: Umbralefic Crystal
enhancements.effect: Thousand Sons model only. Once per battle, in your Command phase, you can remove the bearer’s unit from the battlefield. If you do, in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set that unit back up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.

enhancements.name: Arcane Vortex
enhancements.effect: Thousand Sons model only. Add 1 to the Strength and Damage characteristics of Psychic weapons equipped by the bearer.

stratagems.name: Psychic Dominion
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One Thousand Sons unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, all attacks made against your unit with Psychic weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability and all models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic Attacks.

stratagems.name: Destined by Fate
stratagems.when: Any phase, when a saving throw is failed for a Thousand Sons Psyker model from your army.
stratagems.target: That Psyker model.
stratagems.effect: Change the Damage characteristic of that attack to 0.

stratagems.name: Devastating Sorcery
stratagems.target: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Psychic Attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: Ensorcelled Infusion
stratagems.target: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, all inferno bolt pistols, inferno boltguns, inferno combi-bolters and inferno combi-weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PSYCHIC] ability and a Strength characteristic of 5.

stratagems.name: Sorcerous Might
stratagems.target: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, add 9" to the range of Psychic weapons equipped by your unit.

stratagems.name: Warp Sight
stratagems.target: One Thousand Sons Psyker unit from your army and one enemy unit that is visible to that unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Thousand Sons Psyker model makes an attack with a Psychic weapon that targets that enemy unit, that attack has the [INDIRECT FIRE] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

abilities.name: Treason of Tzeentch (Psychic)
abilities.effect: At the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 24" of and visible to this Psyker. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

data.name: Mutating Vortex (Aura)
data.effect: At the end of your Movement phase, roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 6" of this model: on a 2-3, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 4-5, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds. Each enemy unit within range of this ability must then take a Battle-shock test.

data.name: Immaterial Flare (Aura)
data.effect: While a friendly Thousand Sons Psyker unit is within 6" of this model, each time that unit uses a Ritual that specifies a range, you can double that range while resolving that Ritual.

data.name: Bringers of Change
data.effect: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If the target of that attack is within range of an objective marker you do not control, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

wargear.name: Icon of Flame
wargear.effect: Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, if a Critical Wound is scored, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

data.name: Bringers of Change
data.effect: While this unit contains one or more Psyker models, each time an attack is made against this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than this unit’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

leader.name: Empyric Guidance (Psychic)
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

leader.name: Illusions of Tzeentch (Psychic)
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, that unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

leader.name: Empyric Guidance (Psychic)
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

data.name: Marked by Fate (Psychic)
data.effect: In your Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this model. Until the end of the turn, each time a friendly Thousand Sons model makes an attack that targets that unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

data.name: Pawns of Fate
data.effect: Each time this unit destroys an enemy unit, roll one D6: on a 2+, you gain 1CP. When this unit is destroyed, roll one D6: on a 2+, you gain 1CP.

data.name: The Weave of Fate (Psychic)
data.effect: Once per battle, at the start of any phase, you can select one friendly Rubric Marines or Scarab Occult Terminators unit within 6" of this model. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [PRECISION] ability.

data.name: Glamour of Tzeentch (Aura, Psychic)
data.effect: While a friendly Thousand Sons unit is within 6" of this model, models in that unit have the Stealth ability.

data.name: Sorcerous Fire (Psychic)
data.effect: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over this phase and roll nine D6: for each 6, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

data.name: Aetherstride (Psychic)
data.effect: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this model is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, you can remove it from the battlefield and then, in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models. If the battle ends and this model is not on the battlefield, it is destroyed.

data.name: Malign Trickery
data.effect: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to D6" as if it were your Movement phase.

leader.name: Dark Blessing (Psychic)
leader.effect: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

data.name: Bestial Prophet
data.effect: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

data.name: Relic Hunters
data.effect: At the end of your Command phase, roll one D6 for each objective marker you control that has one or more units from your army with this ability within range of it: for each 4+, you gain 1 Cabal point.

wargear.name: Herd Banner
wargear.effect: You can re-roll Battle-shock tests taken for the bearer’s unit.

wargear.name: Brayhorn
wargear.effect: You can re-roll Advance and Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit.
